website_summaries.verdict: Extremely high price point, but it's basically the perfect hammer with excellent build quality.
pros: You'll pay a lot for the titanium construction, but it provides a high level of driving power
A 15-ounce titanium greatly outperforms a steel hammer of similar weight
Extremely tough, will last a long time
Hammer head contains magnet to help hold the nail in place while you start driving it
cons: Hammer's balance feels odd to some people

customer_reviews.title: Must have for carpenters
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend says it's the best hammer he's ever had in his 20 years as a carpenter. I say for 200 dollars it should swing it's self and spoon him at night. Could say more but I am a lady... AND the carpenter of 20 years who uses it everyday won't ever purchase anything else, also he claims superior quality , buy it once and have it for life.
customer_reviews.author: Shamrocker1973

customer_reviews.title: If you swing your hammer all day long do yourself ...
customer_reviews.text: If you swing your hammer all day long do yourself a favor & spend the money on this... with every penny. No more elbow pain. Just make sure you don't leave it laying around on the jobsite.
customer_reviews.author: IV

customer_reviews.title: best hammer ever
customer_reviews.text: best hammer I have ever owned light but same swing I have use my whole career. wish I had this years ago might have saved my elbow. the side nail puller is awesome. takes the jerk off my elbow.
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: Went from a standard 19oz Vaughn framer to this hammer. World of difference. The first time I used it I understood why they are so expensive. I use it non stop every day. Been using it for 2 months now and no complaints. All around top quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Vosika

customer_reviews.title: Bad to the bone
customer_reviews.text: Took me a long time to buy this hammer. After just one day of building forms and the next day stripping forms I would have to say its worth every penny

customer_reviews.title: Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my husband for Christmas. It was something he would never have purchased for himself but now prizes. He has told me a many ways that makes it superior to an ordinary hammer; the weight balance, the nail holder, shock reduction. He is remodeling our kitchen with more pep in his work!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My friend loves her hammer. She uses it at Habitat for Humanity.

customer_reviews.title: You'll never have to worry about breaking a hammer again
customer_reviews.text: Strong, effective, lightweight, and just easy to use all day long. Absolutely love it and so do the guys I work with

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer

customer_reviews.title: It does in fact hammer correctly.
customer_reviews.text: I hit a metal stick into a wooden stick a few times and a house popped out.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Used almost daily after 2 years! Helps a lot with my torn rotor cuff swinging a hammer, wish I bought one years ago!!!

customer_reviews.title: ... one for 4 years now and it has been great, only thing is you need a little loc ...
customer_reviews.text: My dad and I had one for 4 years now and it has been great, only thing is you need a little loc tight on the bolt that holds the head on or it comes loose
customer_reviews.author: zach wedekind

customer_reviews.title: It's a stiletto what else can I say
customer_reviews.text: They're stilettos so they're a bit pricey for a hammer. But it definitely helps with my tennis elbow

customer_reviews.text: My husband is a master carpenter. This helps saves his wrists for sure! He really likes it!

customer_reviews.title: Lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: I like this Stilleto the grip on it fits just perfect in my hand. It’s perfect for driving nails and pulling stubborn stuck nails that hit a knot.

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a backup to my desalt nail gun

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: in the short amount of time I’ve been in the trade, I can’t see my self buying any other hammer in the future. Best feature to me is the side nail puller. Highly recommend it. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Hector F Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Spend the money. Will save you from so many issues down the road if you use a hammer a lot. I should have bought it years ago. Don't make that mistake.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have been swinging a hammer professionally for over 36 years, this hammer hits like a 22oz and saves my elbow!

customer_reviews.title: Carpenter’s Choice!!! 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: This is saving my elbow. Can DEFINITELY notice how much more power this has compared to a steel hammer...considering how light it feels swinging this beast!
customer_reviews.author: Chrisopher Fondell

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with a Stiletto!
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? My mini has lasted over 10 years of scaffolding and still going. Wanted the bigger one also.

customer_reviews.title: handle has fallen to bits
customer_reviews.text: The handle has let the tool down, it has split and cracked and now is dangerous to use, i eintend on sending it back to get replacement or money back

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't feel like you're swinging anything but drives nails with ease
customer_reviews.text: What a change from any hammer I've used. Doesn't feel like you're swinging anything but drives nails with ease. The side nail puller is absolutely perfect and can pull out a 16 in one motion

customer_reviews.title: Swings like a dream.
customer_reviews.text: It's the best hammer in the world for a reason, you just can't out do it if you tried.

customer_reviews.title: Best Hammer of all time
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammer. It's loaded and balanced properly and I can swing it all day long without any fatigue! It is extremely light and it's extremely hard. It is an expensive hammer however it is well worth the price.

customer_reviews.title: Master Carpenters hammer.
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my Master Carpenter son in law. He was thrilled.

customer_reviews.text: Just wonder is there the L key for swapping the Miller face? It should be come with the hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Short of Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have titanium hips so why not a titanium hammer? Wish I had bought this years ago! Light and powerful. Expensive but worth it. Not nearly as much as my hips were though!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Best hammer out.
customer_reviews.text: Best tool I've ever owned. Spend the money, your elbow will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Glen abney

customer_reviews.title: Best hammer money can buy
customer_reviews.text: Best hammer I've ever owned. It's light and little to no vibration. I like the fact that you can replace the heads. This will be a long lasting tool and my choice from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't entirely sure if I'd like it after using a fiberglass handled and a wood ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't entirely sure if I'd like it after using a fiberglass handled and a wood handled stiletto for a couple years. After breaking a couple wood handles from prying with the claw, I decided I'd give the Ti-bone a try. I'm glad I did! It is comfortable to swing all day like my other hammers, and I can hang from it and not worry about it breaking. I still reach for my fiberglass handled hammer for finish, but for framing and demo this hammers swinging from my belt
customer_reviews.author: Krisp

customer_reviews.title: life time hammer
customer_reviews.text: As a framing contactor my hammer is a tool that I not only need but Is essential to my day in and day out tasks. This makes hand banging rafters even more pleasant. I use to have a stiletto musclehead and that was great but I was always worried about snapping the head but this I have no worries. The side pull nailer really comes in handy also, me and my crew call it the can opener. Its light and has really nice anti vibration properties. sinks 10 penny nails in 2 shots consistently. as a word of caution check the head to make sure it hasn't loosened up on you.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Gravel

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my son for his work and he absolutely loves it
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: A great tool, worth it's weight in gold. I became adjusted to this hammer in a matter of swings, as opposed to a matter of days for a cheap wood handled hammer. Quality is amazing and nothing less than expected for such a hammer. Don't let it leave your hip on the jobsite!
customer_reviews.author: Everett

customer_reviews.title: Best hammer you can buy.
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper online than any store. I swing a hammer all day at work driving nails. This thing reduces the vibrations you normally get and after one day of use you will never go back. I know it's a ridiculous about for a hammer but it is well worth it. It has a long handle that can get annoying in your belt loop. Be warned if you get the milled face it will a "pining" noise when driving nails. Used it to; Drive nails Chip concrete Snap ties Pull 16p nails with ease Anything you use a normal hammer for. It's a tool don't be afraid to use it like many others are
customer_reviews.author: ChevyTruck

customer_reviews.title: Wise investment
customer_reviews.text: All around the best hammer ive bought besides Martinez. Can swing it all day and not feel wore out.
customer_reviews.author: Clinten Lang

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great hammer well worth the money for somebody who needs a hammer every day
customer_reviews.author: david jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Its a beast
customer_reviews.text: This hammer shames all others. I use it from framing to finish and absolutly everywhere in between. I have zero issues with it. The only complaint I have ever heard from anyone about these is that they are "long". They are as long as any framer Ive ever swung. This is a very hard hitting hammer. The 12 gauge of hammers, if you will. And it weighs less than a tiny 16oz. Update: I stopped using this for finish work. I bought the 10oz fiberglass titanium head finish hammer! The Ti-bone is definitely my new industry standard. I wish I could buy one for every carpenter still swinging an estwing.
customer_reviews.author: Kas Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great hammer this is my 2nd one the first one lasted me 15 years worth the price

customer_reviews.title: Amazon was terrific with replacement - didn't even need to return broken ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter who is a carpenter. She loves it, but the head broke after about 3 weeks of use. Amazon was terrific with replacement - didn't even need to return broken parts and a new one is on the way. My daughter even called the manufacturer, who indicated a failure was highly unusual. So, assuming the replacement has no problems, sounds like a great hammer.

customer_reviews.title: Good investment for your joints

Says it drives great and with a lot of power behind it considering how light it is. His boss is going to buy one now after using my husbands for half the day. The other subcontractors have also been very impressed with it. The price is a little crazy for a hammer, but if this is a career for you- it's a great investment in your joints.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Lightweight HAMMER
customer_reviews.text: This is a great hammer for everyday carpenters. Its light weight but hard hitting and very minimal vibrations but buyers need to be aware that this hammer is a "long" handled hammer. I use this hammers for my daily tasks making wooden concrete forms this hammer is perfect. My previous hammer was also a stiletto but it was a 14oz hammer and it has straight handle. I got it many years ago and it was time to get this 15oz hammer. Very very happy with this product.

A little costly but its a hammer you can use for the rest of your life!

customer_reviews.title: Terrific hammer but bad grip design
customer_reviews.text: Terrific hammer but bad grip design. There is a rubber lip that gets pulled on every time taking out of holster. Why didn't they make it like estwing so there is a metal lip at the hammer grip to stop this. Almost perfect but for this price it could of been better

He was always raving on about how good it was, so when I drove a few nails with it I liked the feel of it as well and decided 2 buy 1. Once I got my own and got used 2 it I love it even more. Curved handle has a lovely feel, perfect weight, drives any nail with ease, no repetitive strain injury, but the side pullers is the wow factor, it is brilliant!! It's a lot of money for a hammer, but if you're gonna be using it day in day out, you'll be very happy with the investment!

product_meta.title: Stiletto TB15MC Claw Hammer
product_meta.description:
Stiletto framing hammer, straight claw, 15 oz head, 17-1/2 in overall length, milled face, 1-1/2 in face diameter, titanium head, curved handle, titanium handle, rubber grip, black handle.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Engineered for the user, this titanium hammer is a precision nail-driving tool. Its solid titanium construction offers extreme durability and its ergonomic injection-molded grip offer great comfort and even greater control. This hammer features a lightweight 15-ounce head, yet its driving force equals 24-ounce steel. Removable steel nose piece allows the user to replace the face in a few minutes. Also features a convenient magnetic nail starter.
feature_bullets: Stiletto framing hammer, straight claw, 15 oz head, 17-1/2 in overall length, milled face, 1-1/2 in face diameter, titanium head, curved handle, titanium handle, rubber grip, black handle
Provides secure connections to components and lines
This product is manufactured in United States

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars310 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
